intro: Wettinella quinaria, commonly known as the Queensland wettinella, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or inland regions. Its inflorescence consists of dense clusters of small, pale green to yellowish flowers. Wettinella quinaria is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
